intro: Senecio kurtzii, commonly known as the Kirtz's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming structure with silver-green leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Senecio kurtzii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and drought tolerance.
